sentences.en: a need for greater coordination between departments
sentences.cn: 各部门间加强配合的必要

sentences.en: All the tetraderadentate ligands were found to be effective with copper, which forms planar four - coordination complexes.
sentences.cn: 所有四价配位体对铜都有钝化效果,能与铜形成平面的四价配位络合物.

sentences.en: Enough information is available to infer that membranes serve in coordination.
sentences.cn: 现有足够的资料表明,膜起着协调作用.

sentences.en: Gymnastics is a sport that requires a considerable level of coordination.
sentences.cn: 体操是一项需要高协调性的运动.

sentences.en: Interior decoration by careful coordination seems to have had its day.
sentences.cn: 精心搭配的室内装饰似乎已不再受欢迎了。

sentences.en: Intoxication interferes with memory and thinking, speech and coordination.
sentences.cn: 醉酒影响记忆、思考、语言与协调性。

sentences.en: Intoxication interferes with speech and coordination.
sentences.cn: 醉酒会影响言语能力和协调性。

sentences.en: Lack planning coordination can be extremely costly.
sentences.cn: 规划缺乏协调,势必造成极大的浪费.

sentences.en: Specific evidence for coordination complexes between pesticides and clay minerals is quite limited.
sentences.cn: 关于农药和粘土矿物之间的配位络合的明确证据是十分有限的.

sentences.en: the coordination of our economic policies
The number of ions needed for screening the electrical field is known as the coordination number.
sentences.cn: 屏蔽电场所需要的离子数称为配位数.

sentences.en: The number of ligands attached to the central ion is called the coordination number.
sentences.cn: 同中心离子连接的配位体,数目称为配位数.

sentences.en: The perfect coordination of the dancers and singers added a rhythmic charm to the performance.
sentences.cn: 舞蹈演员和歌手们配合得很好,使演出更具魅力.

sentences.en: This exercise improves your coordination, balance, timing and footwork.
sentences.cn: 这项锻炼可以提高协调能力、平衡力、把握时机的能力和脚法。

sentences.en: Too much alcohol affects your coordination.
sentences.cn: 喝酒太多会影响你动作的协调。

sentences.en: You need good hand - eye coordination to play racket sports.
sentences.cn: 网球之类的运动需要良好的手眼协调能力.

sentences.en: You need good hand-eye coordination to play racket sports .
sentences.cn: 网球之类的运动需要良好的手眼协调能力。

words.tran_cn: 同等的；使…协调的；配位价的
协调者；[自] 协调器；同等的人或物
调整；使调和（coordinate的过去分词）；调节；整理

trans.tran_en: the way in which your muscles move together when you perform a movement
